result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan O Morris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 10-15-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court will grant expungement if the defendant commits no new violations (for a one year period) and completes 30 hours of community service by 04-15-2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan O Morris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donovan O Morris in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin with student intern David Depeau.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Sentencing proceeded.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 10-15-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court will grant expungement if the defendant commits no new violations (for a one year period) and completes 30 hours of community service by 04-15-2016.

Defendant Donovan O Morris in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court grants request. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Donovan O Morris in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Donovan O Morris in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Donovan O Morris in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Protasiewicz, Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
